meanings.definition: A notebook or journal for writing notes or keeping records.
meanings.sent1: I always carry my cahier to jot down important information.
meanings.sent2: She opened her cahier to a blank page and started writing.
meanings.sent3: The cahier seemed to have a mind of its own, filling up with notes faster than she could write.
meanings.sent4: Her cahier was a treasure trove of memories, each page holding a piece of her life.
meanings.sent5: The cahier was like a loyal friend, always there to listen to her thoughts and secrets.

meanings.definition: A booklet or pamphlet containing information or exercises.
meanings.sent1: The teacher handed out a cahier to each student for the upcoming assignment.
meanings.sent2: He flipped through the cahier, scanning the exercises to be completed.
meanings.sent3: The cahier was so full of facts, it felt like a mini library in his hands.
meanings.sent4: Her cahier was a map to success, guiding her through each lesson with precision.
meanings.sent5: The colorful cahier was a beacon of knowledge, drawing students in with its vibrant pages.

meanings.definition: A collection of sheets of paper folded together and sewn or stapled along one edge.
meanings.sent1: She carefully bound the loose papers into a cahier to keep them organized.
meanings.sent2: The cahier lay flat on the table, its pages neatly aligned.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous wind picked up the cahier and scattered its pages like confetti.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were like loose pages until he compiled them into a cahier of ideas.
meanings.sent5: The cahier was a bridge between chaos and order, holding together the scattered pieces of his work.
